bibl.title: The Egyptian Royal Titularies of the Roman Emperors: A Local Version of the Imitatio Alexandri?
bibl.note: Introduction. - The royal titulary of Octavian Augustus. - Egyptian protocol and Augustan imitatio Alexandri. - Later emperors. - Pp. 298-305: Table 1. Parallels between the emperors' Egyptian titularies and those of the Macedonian and Ptolemaic rulers.
bibl.seg: Francisco Bosch-Puche, The Egyptian Royal Titularies of the Roman Emperors: A Local Version of the Imitatio Alexandri?

Introduction. - The royal titulary of Octavian Augustus. - Egyptian protocol and Augustan imitatio Alexandri. - Later emperors. - Pp. 298-305: Table 1. Parallels between the emperors' Egyptian titularies and those of the Macedonian and Ptolemaic rulers.
